entries.meaning: (countable) The antler of a hart, once used as a source of ammonia.
(dated) An aqueous solution of ammonia; smelling salts.
examples: Lady Teazle seeing Sir Peter in such Danger—ran out of the Room in strong Hysterics—and Charles after her calling out for Hartshorn and Water!

verbs.description: hartshorn (third-person singular simple present hartshorns, present participle hartshorning, simple past and past participle hartshorned)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To revive with hartshorn smelling salts.
